hello
Hello blank fragment
Always clean hands by rubbing them with an alcohol disinfectant or washing them thoroughly with soap and water
When greeting guests at home, the salutation is one meter away through: hand-waving, gesture or bending.
Have everyone at home wash their hands, including guests.
Constant cleaning of surfaces and especially touched objects.
If you develop symptoms of the emerging coronavirus, contact your healthcare professional before going.
Keep up-to-date on the virus, from reliable sources.
When coughing and sneezing, be sure to cover your mouth and nose with your folded elbow or a tissue, and dispose of the tissue immediately and wash your hands.
Avoid approaching people with fever and cough, and keep a distance of at least one meter (3 feet).
The masks should not be reused and not touched from the front. The use of the N95 respirator mask protects against the virus only when used properly.
Antibiotics are not effective in preventing the virus, they only kill the germs.

Hand dryers are not effective in eliminating the virus within 30 seconds. Rather, hands should be cleaned by rubbing them with an alcohol disinfectant, or washed with soap and water and then used dryers.
Spraying the body with alcohol or chlorine does not help eliminate the virus, but it may be harmful to clothing or mucous membranes (such as the eyes and mouth).
Regularly washing the nose with a saline solution does not prevent HIV infection.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth.
If someone in the audience feels it is not well (especially if its symptoms are positive for the emerging coronavirus), be careful not to share the places together.
Make a preparatory plan for you if the virus spreads in your community.
"If you leave the house, try to adhere to all instructions as if you were at home Â "
